about_the_game:
Descend into the chaotic depths of Monday Syndrome a satirical action RPG set in an endless, demonic office tower where corporate hell takes on a whole new meaning. As a lone human trapped in this infernal workplace, you must battle your way through possessed coworkers, climb the corporate ladder, and survive the daily grind. Literally.

Weapon Customization

Mix and match weapon attacks from an absurd array of office supplies, like staplers that shoot paperclips and coffee pots that explode into scalding showers of coffee. Every weapon can be customized, with basic and advanced attacks ready to swap for endless playstyles.

Procedural Office Floors

No two playthroughs are alike with randomized floors, rooms, and enemies in the ever-shifting tower. Discover secret rooms and face unexpected hazards at every corner.

Crafting System

Combine different weapon parts and attack types to create ridiculous yet deadly office-themed tools of destruction. Swap out coffee splash for paperclip barrages and find the perfect synergy for your battle plan.

Demonic Foes and Office Horrors

Face off against a variety of corrupted office workers turned demonic beings. From mindless imps to elite minibosses, these fiendish enemies are anything but typical coworkers. Survive, as you progress through the corporate hellscape.

Engaging Combat

Fast-paced, fluid combat where every animation counts. There's no cooldown; the moment an attack animation ends, you're ready to strike again or switch to another move. Timing and adaptability are key.

Bosses and Endless Mode

Battle through the corporate hierarchy to face the ultimate challenge: Lucifiler. The malevolent CEO of the underworld's most sinister corporation. Defeat him to unlock endless mode or face a restart upon your demise.

Join the Corporate Chaos

Escape the madness or become a permanent employee in hell’s office tower. With its satirical tone and fast-paced, customizable gameplay, Monday Syndrome turns the daily grind into a demonic free-for-all. Prepare yourself for the corporate battle of a lifetime.
